intro: Anemone stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf anemone, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes many showy, often toxic flowers. The plant features delicate, palmate leaves and white or pale pink petals that resemble a crown, typical of the genus Anemone. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
